com.github.jinahya.tv.xlet

Class XletContextHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jinahya.util.SynchronizedHolder<T>
      • com.github.jinahya.util.AtomicHolder<javax.tv.xlet.XletContext>
        • com.github.jinahya.tv.xlet.XletContextHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Holder<javax.tv.xlet.XletContext>

    public class XletContextHolder
extends AtomicHolder<javax.tv.xlet.XletContext>
    A utility class holding an XletContext. 

     
 public void initXlet(final XletContext xletContext) {
     XletContextHolder.getIntstance().set(xletContext);
     // other statements here
 }

 public void destroyXlet(final boolean unconditional) {
     // other statements here
     XletContextHolder.getInstance().set(null);
 }

    Not any codes executed between initXlet and destroyXlet can use it like this. 

     
 class SomeOther {
     public void doSomethingWithXletContext() {
         final XletContext xletContext
             = (XletContext) XletContextHolder.getInstance().get();
         // do something with xletContext
     }
 }

    Author:
    Jin Kwon <jinahya at gmail.com>
